DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: DE ROSE, E. H.;De Rose, E. H.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: O Prof. De Rose possui graduaзгo em Medicina pela Fundaзгo Universidade Federal de Ciкncias da Saъde de Porto Alegre/Brasil (1966), Doutorado &quot;cum laude&quot; em Medicina pela Universitдt zu Kцln de Colфnia/Alemanha (1985), Doutorado &quot;cum laude&quot; em Medicina e Cirurgia pela Universita degli Studi La Sapienza de Roma/Itбlia (1991), alйm dos cursos de especializaзгo em Medicina do Esporte (UFRGS), em Educaзгo Fнsica, Saъde Escolar e Recreaзгo (UFRGS) e Medicina e Biologia do Esporte pela Universitй de Tours/Franзa.Й Especialista em Medicina do Esporte pela Deutscher Sportarztbund da Alemanha e pela Federaзгo Brasileira de Medicina Desportiva. Й Professor Titular Emйrito da Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul, onde foi Coordenador do Curso de Especializaзгo em Medicina do Esporte da ESEF-UFRGS e do mesmo curso na Faculdade de Medicina da Pontifнcia Universidade Catуlica do Rio Grande do Sul. Й membro fundador da Agencia Mundial Antidoping (WADA), onde integrou o seu Conselho de Fundaзгo, Comitк Executivo e a Comissгo de Saъde, Ciкncia e Medicina, de 1999 a 2012. Foi membro da Comissгo Mйdica e Cientнfica do Comitк Olнmpico Internacional (COI) de 1984 a 2012, e da Comissгo Mйdica do Comitк Olнmpico Brasileiro (COB) de 1987 a 2017. Presidiu a Comissгo de Combate ao Doping do Ministйrio da Saъde desde sua criaзгo, de 2004 atй 2011. Presidiu a Comissгo Mйdica da Organizaзгo Esportiva Pan-Americana (ODEPA) de 1979 a 2016, e a Federaзгo Internacional de Medicina do Esporte de 1994 a 2002, sendo atualmente Presidente Honorбrio da mesma. Exerce desde 2016 a funзгo de Auditor do Tribunal de Justiзa Desportiva Antidoping da Secretaria Nacional do Esporte, vinculada ao Ministйrio da Cidadania. Tem experiкncia na бrea de Medicina, com кnfase em Medicina do Esporte, Controle de Doping e Fisiologia do Exercнcio.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Prof. De Rose holds a degree in Medicine from the Federal University of Health Sciences Foundation of Porto Alegre/Brazil (1966), a Doctorate &quot;cum laude&quot; in Medicine from the Universitдt zu Kцln de Cologne/Germany (1985), a Doctorate in Medicine and Surgery from the Universita degli Studi La Sapienza de Rome/Italy (1991). In addition to that, specialization courses in Sports Medicine (UFRGS), in Physical Education, School Health and Recreation (UFRGS) and Medicine and Biology of Sport by the Universitй de Tours/France. He is Specialist in Sports Medicine by Deutscher Sportarztbund of Germany and the Brazilian Federation of Sports Medicine. He is Full Professor Emeritus of the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul, where he was Coordinator of the Specialization Course in Sports Medicine at ESEF-UFRGS and from the same course at the Faculty of Medicine of the Pontifical Catholic University of Rio Grande do Sul. He is a founding member of the World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA), where he joined its Foundation Board, Executive Committee, and the Health, Medical and Science Committee from 1999 to 2012. He was a member of the Medical and Scientific Committee of the International Olympic Committee (IOC), from 1984 to 2012, and of the Medical Commission of the Brazilian Olympic Committee (COB) from 1987 to 2017 and chaired the Anti-Doping Commission of the Brazilian Ministry of Health from 2004 to 2011. He chaired the Medical Commission of the Pan American Sports Organization (ODEPA) from 1979 to 2016, and the International Federation of Sports Medicine from 1994 to 2002, and is currently Honorary President. Since 2016, he has been acting as Auditor of the Court of Sports Anti-Doping of the National Secretariat of Sport, linked to the Ministry of Citizenship. He has experience in Medicine, with emphasis on Sports Medicine, Doping Control and Exercise Physiology.
